description: This versatile vinaigrette, inspired by Caesar dressing, is packed with anchovy, garlic, and lemon.
headline: The Homemade Dressing That Makes Me Excited to Eat Salad

HowtoTip.text: Storage: Refrigerate in an airtight container up to 1 week. Rewhisk before using.

name: The Homemade Dressing That Makes Me Excited to Eat Salad
recipeIngredient: 2 cloves garlic, or 2 frozen garlic cubes
2 teaspoons anchovy paste, or 4 anchovy fillets
1/3 cup neutral oil, such as grapeseed, vegetable, or canola

recipeInstructions.text: Finely grate the zest of 1 medium lemon (about 2 packed teaspoons) into a small jar or bowl. Juice the lemon (about 3 tablespoons) into the bowl. Finely chop 2 garlic cloves (if using anchovy fillets, finely chop 4 together with the garlic), chopping until it is paste-like. Add the garlic and anchovy or 2 teaspoons anchovy paste to the bowl.

Add 1/3 cup neutral oil, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, and a few grinds of black pepper if desired. Whisk or seal and and shake the jar until combined and emulsified.

video.description:
Salad dressing at my house used to come in one of two forms: a store-bought bottle or a homemade one that was honestly pretty lackluster. Designed to have a long shelf life, my homemade one didn’t have any fresh ingredients like garlic or shallots but relied on just vinegar, mustard, and oil instead. While it was perfectly fine, it didn’t make meals exciting to eat; rather, it was used out of sheer convenience for the occasional dinner side salad.

See the full recipe [HERE](https://www.thekitchn.com/christines-house-dressing-recipe-23078966)
